Side Effects: The oncologist first prescribed Arimidex_ which I only took for 4 months due to the severe joint pain.  I could barely get in and out of my car.  I was then prescribed Aromasin and tried it for about 18 months and the hip pain became so bad I could not sleep and my cholesterol was almost 300.   So I took a six month vacation from the drug.  My cholesterol is now well under 200 and the hip pain is almost gone.
Comments: While I understand that the first five years after a cancer diagnosis are very important_ if I continue to take this drug I will end up on a statin and pain medicine.   Taking those will only cause even more side effects.   I am talking with a naturopath to look for some alternative ways to prevent any future occurrence of cancer_ there has to be a better way than this drug.

Side Effects: Hot flashes_  joint pain in hands sometimes so bad I could not use fingers which I need to do my job.  One elbow joint pain.  Bladder pain and pressure like an infection but it wasn't an infection.   Antibiotics did not help.
Comments: This drug is horrible for me.  My oncologist is NOT happy I stopped it and refuse to try it again.  I felt like I had a bladder infection but antibiotics did not clear it up.  Since I work in a lab I did my own urine tests and could see I had bladder irritation signs but no infection.  About 3 weeks after stopping the drug the bladder symptoms  are gone.  My knuckles in my hand hurt badly and I have trouble using my fingers and they "lock"up sometimes.  I also have one elbow that hurts.  I talked to my oncologist nurse today who said I can go back on the meds since I have been off them a month and the hand pain is NOT from aromasin.  I am still having hot flashes.  I believe the drug is out of my system but the side effects and damage the drug causes is not gone which is why the hot flashes and pain is still there.  I told the nurse I will not take anything until the pain is less.  I know my body and I know from another drug I took years ago it can take MONTHS to get over the side effects and damage from the drug.  I wonder if it worth trying something else.  I was given a 4% chance of cancer returning with the drug and 8% without.  I had a mastectomy and no chemo or radiation needed.

Side Effects: Mainly_ severe mood swings - depression and anger/rage_ severe pain on my knees causing difficulty to walk after getting up then pain goes away_ insomia_ weight gain.
Comments: My mom was placed on same medication for 5years and saw the same SE on her.  On a side note_ breast ca doesn't run on our family.  We are both BRCA neg. Knowing the SE_ I was mindful of what I am feeling and I try to control the SE as much as I can.  I keep myself busy most of the days so I don't feel depressed.  As for the anger/rage_ I identified my trigger sources and I try to avoid them as much as I can (not 100% successful).  I watch what I eat but I'm also not 100% successful on this category.  I have gained weight (and I thought it was due to chemo tx).  My onc have given me clonazepam to help me sleep and relax at night.  I also take tylenol (with codeine) to help with the pain.  My onc also told me he thinks I should be on this drug for 10years (vs 5yrs for my mom) bec new study came out showing better outcome for my stage of cancer to stay on it for 10years.  I try not to think about this.

Side Effects: Diarrhea_ vaginal bleeding_ insomnia_ weight loss
Comments: The vaginal bleeding is what really disturbs me - I can live with the other side effects.  Now I need to have hysteroscopy to determine if there is any other reason for the bleeding.

Side Effects: Some joint pain_ my back continues to crack throughout the day.
Comments: Was on Arimidex for 5 months. By the 5'th month had difficulty getting out of chairs and walking for first few minutes up. Knee pain and hip pain at night made sleeping very difficult. Dr switched to exemestane.  But I first stayed off both for a month.  Joint pain is better but will see what this month will bring.  Back cracking is bizarre.  At least I don't look 90 when I walk. If symptom return to same degree I won't wait it out this time will ask ti switch.  Gained 10 pounds so far.

Side Effects: I thought I was losing my.mind_ couldn't understand why I started having extreme joint pain in my hands_ then in my hips & ankles. I am extremely frustrated that their was no forewarning by my oncologist.
Comments: I have been taking this pill for only 3.5 weeks. I played soccer & worked out during chemo_ yet I almost feel worse now than during chemo.

Side Effects: Severe muscle and joint pain_ swelling in my right hand_ fatigue and depression_ insomnia_ headache and brain fog. Pain worse when laying down and mornings. No energy and no desire to do anything_ decrease in libido_ more tearful and emotional than usual. Not worth it!!!!
Comments: I took Arimidex for a few months with same type side effects_ when I stopped taking it the side effects subsided. But after just one month of Aromasin I stopped taking it and 3 months later still have severe pain. Does anyone know how long this will continue? I am done!

Side Effects: Big toe pain fire sensation within the same foot. Weight gain of 10 pounds not stopping averaging about 1.5 pounds a week. My Dr. Told me to quit because I am also ostopena I am scared but relieved
Depression extreme fatigue acid reflux lethargy neutropenia nausea
Comments: A very difficult medication to tolerate I have to push myself each day to walk or swim as this makes me feel better the fatigue is difficult to live with

I have been on this drug for 6yrs 6mths and intend to complete 7yrs_ could be longer. Dr says it could return_ so taking this 2 more years makes me feel more comfortable. Weight is kept ok with reasonable healthy eating and walking 30 mins a day 5 days a week and 2 classes of aerobic / Pilates. It takes a great deal of effort_ but after I feel so much better with no stiffness and aches until end of the day.

Side Effects: I have EVERY side effect of this drug and am already considering stopping it. Weight gain and no stamina indeed. Loosing hair_ nausea_ EVERYTHING.I feel poisoned.
Sore feet aand other joint pain. Less energy_ and a feeling of a ''confused'' brain. Tiredness_ lethargy! Depression on some days! I have gained weight!
Comments: I am upset_ that I have gained so much weight_ an yet lack the stamina_ to do effective exercise!

Side Effects: suddenly sugar has spiked
Comments: i have not had any other issues but suddenly my sugar was running high.  I have had it under control

Side Effects: My feet are on fire_ very very tired_ extremely thirsty _ weight gain and over feeling just yucky!

Hot flashes severe_ weight gain_ joint pain. 0nly 2 weeks taking it. Now oncologist added Boniva for osteopenia. Made me think and decided to stop. Heard horrific things about Boniva. Had lumpectomy and radiation one breast. Why be miserable? My prognosis is very good without drugs. I'm active and exercise. Feel I made good decision and still at low risk.
Comments: Oncologists practice cookie cutter medicine. They have a drug to combat side effects for other drugs. Not happy with how I felt on aromasin. Won't try anything else.

Side Effects: Although I was not diagnosed with BC_ I'm high risk since my mom is a bc survivor.  I've been on this drug going on 9 months. At first I didn't notice really any side effects except fatigue and that was after about a month.  A couple months later I started developing insomnia; joint pain in wrists_ hips_ ankles and feet.  After about 4 months on this drug_ I developed trigger finger in both thumbs.  There were days where it became exceptionally painful to walk because the bottom of my feet felt like they were on fire.When I went for my follow-up to see my onc_ I told her about the se's and as many of you have already experienced_ my onc was very dismissive about my complaints which I resented.At first I wasn't having any issues with weight gain because I'm a T1 diabetic who carefully watches what I eat but suddenly in less than 1 months' time I've gained almost 14 lbs!  I'm also going through horrible mood swings to the point I'm either crying uncontrollably or I'm feeling something akin to 'roid rage' all within a span of a couple minutes.Between the sudden weight gain and the extreme mood swings I am going to see my onc and tell her I want off this drug.
Comments: As a Type 1 Diabetic I got very sick in Aug 2015 and didn't realize I was in Diabetic Ketoacidosis and that by the time I was in ICU I'd had 2 mild heart attacks.  My Diabetes is a bigger threat to me right now than the chance of bc plus I don't know why the onc would put me on this drug given I don't have bc but high risk.  I don't like this 'one size fits all approach'.  Sure glad to find this website and have the kind of validation I need to show my doctor this is not 'all in my head'.My best to each and every one of you.

Side Effects: Started off with Arrimidex and after three weeks had to discontinue because of severe fatigue_ bone and joint pain. Oncologist said discontinue and prescribed Aromasin. After 7 weeks I had to discontinue becsuse of severe headaches_ joint and bone pain_10 pound weight gain_dehydration_ fatigue_ hot flashes and spotting blood.I was referred to a Gynecologist. And to begin taking aromasin again after I start feeling better. It has been one week. I am just beginning to feel some relief.

Hair loss_ rash on forehead_ behind ears_ decreased presence of mind_ severe fatigue. Leg/foot/ankle edema. Knee joint pain severe - could no longer walk_ rise from sitting_ negotiate stairs. Foot neuropathy and blistering. Sudden severe fatigue. High blood pressure.
Comments: A year after removing myself from the drug_ hair has not grown back. Foot pain still present. Knee pain returns frequently. Shooting foot and toe pain - especially if exposed to temperature change. Foot numbness_ lack of temperature control. Frequent leg cramps. Continued high blood pressure. Doctors dismiss pain_ fatigue_ swelling with "it's better than cancer" type comments flavored with "we all get such aches as we age." All this in less than a year. Given some of the severest SEs are irreversible_ I strongly urge you to avoid this drug if quality of life is important to you.

Side Effects: I am experiencing synovitis of the hip and wondered if there was a connection to the Aromasin?  Also_ I was on Anastrazole and switched 10 months ago to Aromasin d/t the severe hip and knee pain and my inability to sleep.  I do sleep better now but the pain in the hips and knees can still get pretty bad.    Also_ two months after starting Aromasin_ I developed carpal tunnel syndrome (never had it before).  One month later I had the surgery to release it and there was still mild nerve damage that has not reversed.
Comments: I noticed that some people are taking a "vacation" from taking Aromasin. I was wondering if they would weigh in...on the results while on "vacation" and when theystarted taking it again.  Thanks

Side Effects: Excruciating bone pain_ blurry eyes_ foggy memory & thoughts_ small sores all over scalp
Comments: Worst drug ever

Side Effects: Hot flashes (not too bad though)_ bad bone/joint pain_ forgetfulness_ weight gain_ sugar craving_ acne and rash_ some insomnia.
Comments: I was on Arimidex for 5 months and had to stop because of extreme bone pain. Exemestane SE are very bad. When I first get up in the morning I am literally hobbling around! I can barely walk_ my ankles are so weak and painful. I have to hold the handrail carefully when going down stairs as one of my ankles has given out on me several times. Back pain so bad that just shifting in a chair can elicit gasps from the pain. Turning over in bed very painful. Ankles_ knees and hips make popping/cracking noises. As many others have said_ I'm 57 but feel 97. One of the worst is weight gain. After my surgery & chemo_ I watched what I ate and lost 15 pounds - docs told me weight was super important - but since being on the AIs I have gained 20+ pounds with no change in eating habits. Losing any weight takes going to 600 calories a day (pretty hard to maintain). Exercise is difficult with the bone pain. Am now taking a mini vacation from it_ after just 7 days off of it_ pain is 2/3 gone_ brain fog is lifting_ I have energy again. I wanted to see how much of what I was experiencing was from the drug. Turns out_ all of it. The doctors just don't seem to understand how this drug can wreck your quality of life. I don't want cancer again_ but have to decide if all this is worth it. As another user suggested_ I will be reporting all of my side effects to the FDA.

Side Effects: Extreme muscle and bone pain that could not be controlled at all with over the counter meds such as Tylenol_ Ibuprofen_ ASA. Prescribed Meds like Tylenol #3_ then Buscopan patch then trimodal provided some relief but not enough. I had all the other side effects listed_ it was a total nightmare for me. I have just quit 10 months short of five years. I just can not deal with it any longer.
Comments: I know it is important to complete your full treatment course on Aromasin but when it becomes so unbearable_ you really need to weigh the risks and side effects you have with the drug vs the expected percentage rates for survival by taking the drug. With a mastectomy and chem alone I was told 93% with the five years on Tamoxifen the first year and a half_ then Aromasin for the same I was told an additional 3% putting me up to 96%. I feel  my survival rate should still be fairly high quoting it 10 months early.

Side Effects: 4 months on drug joint pain abdominal pain wrists ankles hurt so bad calves ache some insomnia fatigue bad!! Sometimes have trouble with fine motor skills and words headache
Comments: I am also on faslodex maybe combo just rough on me hope to get off one was on tamoxifen 5 years Cancer came back in armpit had 27 radiation after nodes removed had chemo when first diagnosed

Side Effects: Painful reflux _ long-lasting burning in my esophagus_ stomach aches_ joint pain_ numbness in my hands_ BAD insomnia_ swelling so bad at night I cannot bend my fingers. Pain in ankles_ feet and back spasms. More frequent headaches_ fatigue_ and depression_ extreme fatigue_ no motivation_ foggy brain_ vision change_ loss of motivation_ stiffness_ and just generally not feeling like doing anything.
Comments: I did two years of Tamoxifen with no problems. My oncologist decided to change me to Arimidex. THAT WAS A MISTAKE! After 2 months on it and weak as can be he changed it to Aromasin. ANOTHER MISTAKE! I felt worse. These medications change your life around completely. Don't take them.

Side Effects: I had taken Arimidex for 9 months and had increasing joint and muscle pain. I went off for a month and most side effects resolved. My oncologist switched me to Aromasin. In about 2 weeks the joint pain started coming back and then the swelling of hands_ feet plus tiredness. I am a nurse besides a patient and this is so uncomfortable. I am going to go off of this and won't even try Femora. I will give Tamoxifen a try in hopes the joint issues are not a problem. I am very active for my age_ have no other health issues and this drug has really affected the quality of my life. I have 4 more years of this type of treatment. My oncologist thinks this is better than Arimidex....Wrong! Hope other patients don't have this experience plus this drug costs more too!  I do my research and read. I appreciate these sites with others experiences as it is so supportive.
Extreme fatigue_ no motivation_ foggy brain. I've never felt so exhausted in my entire life. I can't get off the couch and all I want to do is sleep.
Comments: I feel like I'm a walking zombie. I've never been so tired in my whole life. I am extremely active_ exercise daily_ and have no energy now to do anything. I can't concentrate and I can't put simple sentences together. I'm not sure if the benefit of this drug outweighs the side effects. I don't know what to do. I don't want the cancer to come back but I feel like my quality of life has gone to nothing.

Side Effects: First few weeks were ok_ then started having mild hot flashes_ really BAD insomnia_ and joint pain.  Swelling so bad at night I cannot bend my fingers.  Pain in ankles_ feet and back spasms.  More frequent headaches_ fatigue_ and depression.Stopped menstruating 3 years ago after first round of chemo_ but this month had period with cramping.
Comments: Stopped taking drug_ and will be consulting with Oncologist and Gynocologist_ as they are concerned about menstrual cramps.  I do not want to continue on this drug.  Tamoxifen was bad_ too.  These AI drugs are harder on quality of life than chemo was.

Side Effects: Achy joints_ stomach issues_ some insomnia
Comments: Not sure how much this has helped. Was very ill with Arimidex_ couldn't eat without diarrhea so doctor switched me to Aromasin. Most days I ache in my joints. Wonder if other issues I have_ i.e. Stomach problems_ insomnia_ are related to it as well.  Three more years on it seems like forever but am afraid not to take it.

Side Effects: I already have serious osteoarthritis_ but I'm not feeling worse on the Aromasin. The only side effect I seem to have is extreme insomnia_ which is a real problem.
Comments: Right now this drug is saving my life! After 9 cancer-free years following diagnosis and treatment of Stage IIb ILC in both breasts_ I have a recurrence with bone metastases and am now Stage IV with no cure. I took Tamoxifen for 3 years the first time around and had no problems. Then switched to Femara for the worst 6 months of my life. I lasted a week on Arimidex before finally returning to Tamoxifen for the rest of my 5 years.  So I started Aromasin 5 months ago with trepidation because of my past history with AI's. My only problem is bad insomnia that I keep trying to deal with. I also receive an injection once a month of Xgeva to strengthen bones and alleviate bone pain. That's probably shielding me from the bone pain others are experiencing. I am so grateful that this drug has decreased my tumor markers 75% in 5 months and gotten them well within normal range. Because of the Xgeva I actually have less arthritis pain_ too. Now if I could just sleep better...

Side Effects: bone pain_ joint pain_ knees so stiff i feel like i am 80_ shooting or throbbing pain in arms_ hands_ feet and legs_ cannot sleep_ craving sweets and coffee even though i NEVER did before_ anxious (that could be just the nature of cancer though_ maybe not isolated to the medication) headaches_ shoulder and neck pain (possible MRI next week hoping it is just side effects of this medication)

Carpal tunnel_ severe upper right quadrant pain_ elevated liver enzymes_ elevated Ferritin levels_ severe joint paint_ hair loss_ facial hair_ sweats_ insomnia_ difficult walking up a step of stairs without extreme heart rate_ elevated cholesterol_ bone density loss
Comments: Had to go off of it. After a number of tests for my up right quadrant pain_ the oncologist confirmed that this drug has been reported to cause liver toxicity rather quickly. Also caused my carpal tunnel. Went off of it and in 3 weeks I felt like a NEW person. Fatigue was gone_ pain was gone_ I could finally sleep and I felt ALIVE again. They have now switched me to arimidix. Was was Femara for 4 months and it almost gave me a heart attack. So we will see how Arimidix works. I think these AI drugs will soon tell the tale of how horrible they are. Wouldn't be surprised if in a few yrs you see commercials about them in law suits.

Side Effects: Joint and muscle pain. Can barely stand on my feet in the morning. My ankles feel like they are going to break when I walk. Hands are painful_ have a hard time picking up things. Legs throb all the time. Wrists are weak_ can hardly pick up a cup of coffee have to use 2 hands.Trouble pronouncing words.No desire to do anything_ depression. Hair thinning at the crown of my head. Weight gain.I have 3 more years on this drug_ talking to my oncologist on May 1_ hoping she can help.
Comments: I would like to know if anyone out there who took this drug for 5 years_ was left with any permanent joint or bone damage?

Side Effects: Depression_ liver pain_ stomach pain_ facial hair growing not sleeping well
Comments: Aromat 8 is a very effective herbal Alternative to ER/PR positive breast cancer. The Greek test can help all cancer patients test your blood for the proper vitamins_ herbs_ and chemotherapy effectiveness! There are Naturopath doctor. Western and Alternative meets!

Side Effects: High Blood Pressure_ dizziness_ depression_ sleeplessness_ heart beating fast_ knee pain_
Comments: I have read about this drug and I'm very dissatisfied with it.I have decided to stop using it.

Side Effects: I was taking femara for 8 months couldnt take the joint pain started taking this and im starting the same pain again in my legs and neck is there any body else experience the same thing and will it go away its so hard to work like this

Started with arm pain ..numbing_ swelling then progressed to hand. Abdominal pain followed by elevated liver enzymes. Joint paint_ depression_ extreme fatigue_ vision change_ now excruciating lower right quadrant pain had to go to ER.
Comments: After experiencing so many terrible debilitating pain in various areas..did extensive research and this drug can actually cause perforated appendix. Also known to cause carpal tunnel_ stomach pain_ heart injury. Why is this still on the market? Apparently you must notify the FDA of your side effects and if enough serious ones are reported they reevaluate it to determine its effectiveness and safety. So report your side effects. I was on femera and after 4 months I started experiencing heart palpating so severe. Onco said it was re but to go off for .3 weeks I did and it went away. Then she switched me to aramosin_ I have told her I am going off this and she said to give it a few more months. After my ER visit I am not going back on this killer drug

Side Effects: Insomnia_ nightly hot flashes_ fatigue_ severe bone pain_ depression
Comments: The insomnia and hot flashes were immediate_ the bone pain developed after the first several months as did the fatigue and depression.  My oncologist suggested I stop and consider another drug.  It took about a month before the side effects left_ and I have decided that quality of life is too important to go on one of the other 2 drugs.

Side Effects: Fatigue and pain was a problem within 7 days of beginning 25mg daily. Brain fog_ loss of motivation_ stiffness_ and just generally not feeling like doing anything_ even easy daily tasks.
Comments: Taking this to lower my estrogen levels after 6 months on testosterone replacement therapy. Testosterone is converted into estrogen in the male body and with testosterone replacement it sometimes gets converted at a higher rate leading to very high estrogen levels which can cause many issues from water retention_ male breast development_ and a higher risk of cardiovascular disease. 25mg per day dropped my estrogen to nearly zero. The body uses estrogen for many things_ and getting it super low can cause many problems. Severe joint and bone pain_ fatigue_ depression_ anxiety_ sexual dysfunction are some of them.  Fortunately_ my doctor was very knowledgeable and had me switch to 12.5mg per day. After a month_ I was still struggling_ but not as bad. Estrogen levels tested as still being too low although not as low as before. So next I was told to use 12.5mg every other day. That proved to be the right dosage as it allowed my estrogen levels to balance out in the normal range for a male. Unfortunately for breast cancer patients_ the goal is typically to get estrogen levels extremely low. I am not sure if it is the mechanism that the estrogen is lowered by with the drug_ or if it is an issue of too little estrogen in the body for other functions to remain normal. But for my situation_ once I got my estrogen levels in the normal range_ the side effects were barely noticeable_ compared to before when they made me feel incapacitated.

Side Effects: After having it for 8 days I had to be hospitalized. High fever_ ulcers in the mouth and severe headache.
Comments: After lumpectomy I had four cycles of chemo and radiation.Then I had Tamoxifen for five years. After that my doctor asked me to start aromasin.

Side Effects: Crippling_ terrible arthritis-like pain_ insomnia_ nausea_ post-nasal drip_  thinning hair on crown_ skin rashes_ fatigue hot flashes_ blood clot in groin_ and liver problems. Oh_ and my favorite side effect?  I gained 30-35 pounds in a matter of months & CAN'T get it off!
Comments: I started taking the Aromatase Inhibitors in 2009. My docs tried to tell me that my bone-muscle-joint pain was because of my age (60s) and my weight. It was just ordinary arthritis they all said. Hogwash! I am so tired of doctors laying every health problem on my age or my weight when it is one or more of the drugs I am on. Here's how I know my symptoms are Aromasin drug-related: Every time I take an Aromasin Medication Vacation_ most of my Aromasin side effects go away. And_ I started on Arimdex and then Femara and had the SAME side effects. I stayed on Aromasin since there were no other options. I have not had a 1-month vacation from the Aromasin for 4 years_ but when I did_ my pain decreased. Since I reached my 5 years on this awful drug_ the choice is mine to stay on it or go off. I decided to take another vacation. Within a week_ my pain is nearly all gone and my other symptoms are also improving. I can't believe how much better I feel. I feel like I have my life back. I don't know if I will go back on Aromasin or not. What's the point of taking a drug that makes your daily life a hell? Not what I call a quality life. Why can't they make a drug with fewer side effects for a change?

Side Effects: I have degenerative arthritis to begin with.  This is my 4th anti-estrogen medication. Each one bad_ each one different side effects.  This one is bad. Neck and lower back on fire. Wrists are snapping and experiencing 'shin split' type pain.  It's been a year to date and I am 56 and yep_ feeling like a million. Memory is shot. Tamox - oh Lord was the worst for sweats and vaginal lining deterioration. Does this madnes end. HELP us Dr's_ Come up with something that helps and not have to hurt so much as well.
Comments: They never told us that the 'after effects' of all of this would be so bad. I had a real bad 2 year bout 15 years ago with my neck and back. Ended up with several Dr's_ specialists... a real painful - pain med existance I never want to revisit again but here it is. Yep sex drive - gone_ youthful demeanor - gone_ these meds...are thye worth it? I dont know sisters_ I really dont.

Side Effects: I cannot believe this drug was even approved by the FDA .  It made my bone hurt so bad eventually I could not even get out of bed it was horrible_ my regular doctor prescribed me hydrocodone for the pain I was in I am currently on tamoxifen and am very happy oh I forgot to tell you about the other side effects not sleeping_ anxiety_ my life was not worth living and I often wondered with the amount of money we give to cancer research the medications should be at least tolerable it's horrible to have to go through this and keep thinking if you don't take the medication your going to get cancer again.  I have been very satisfied on tamoxifen and hope it remains this way for the remainder of my 5 years
Severe depression and insomnia. Joint pain_ fatigue_ and foggy brain.
Comments: Stopped taking this drug due to side effects. Went through 6 anti-depression drugs and 3 sleep aids. Side effects got worse. I've been off of aromasin for 5 months and feel really good. Oncologist asked if I would try a different estrogen blocking drug_ but I declined. I would rather feel good for a shorter period of time than stay on that awful drug.

Side Effects: joint pain not to be believed and most recently the bottom of my feet have been so painful I can't walk. Weight gain_ carb cravings_ hot flashes (drenching type but they are not constant) brain fog_ mild depression_ drained of all energy- exhausted constantly_ hair has changed (not thinner yet but more brittle?) high blood pressure for the 1st time in my life (meds now) and just generally feel yucky!
Comments: I am just about done with feeling this way and may just tell the doctor that I can't handle it. Don't wish to try either of the other two and I can't take tamoxifen due to family history of clots/stroke.

Side Effects: I was on Femora 4 years then found a lump in other breast had  full  mastectomy and reconstruction which is what should have happened the first time  Femora did not prevent a recurrence side effects not good but a hundred times better than Aromasin where to start insomnia muscle aches bone pain cough red sore eyes stomach pain gas like I have never experienced head aches I am very active it's getting harder to get out of bed always tired I'm going back to my oncologist with some serious questions about this drug ???????

Depression_ extreme fatigue_ mental fogginess_ moodiness_ constant extreme joint and muscle pain knees_ hips_ low back_ plantar fasciitis_ acne_ muscle aches.  Morning stiffness and after sitting for about an hour causes stabbing hip pain.  This started after taking this for only 1 month with the first 2 weeks onset with everything from all the above to UTI and flu-like symptoms.  I switched from Aromadex due to severe pain the very first week.  Only strong RX pain meds work for this pain but then leaves me constipated and even more mentally dull.  Doc wants to now try Femara.  I don't want to get out of bed each morning and now feel like I'm in my 80s.

Frozen rt thumb_ clicking of other finger joints in non dominant hand. Unable to make a fist first thing in the morning with some swelling. Some pain in toes-feels  like hammer toes. Went off med for 3 weeks-no change.
Comments: These symptoms didn't start until after being on med for 13 mos_ now worried this will be permanent and could progress to other joints in other extremities.

Side Effects: Swelling and pain in joints. Fatigue. Chemo fog still present. Extreme Insomnia. Depression. Severe hot flashes. Throat and stomach problems. Unable to go back to work because of physical weakness and decision making process slow.
Comments: Stopped taking it after 2 years. Have an appointment w/oncologist in 2 weeks to discuss. Oncologist stresses the importance of this drug_ but can no longer live with the side effects.

Reason: Stage IIB Invasive lobular_ ESR pos
Side Effects: I am experiencing hair loss_ thinning of eyebrows and eyelashes. Intermittent headaches some near migraine. Days and nights mixed up. Some days just can't get motivated. Some joint pain primarily knees and neck. But 10000% better than Arimidex!!!!

Comments: I had to give up Aromasin because it starting giving me severe_ daily migraines.  I went on to Arimedex.  That one causes me severe insomnia.  I have gained a total of 50 pounds on these drugs and I am entrenched in the eating disorder.  I now have only 7 more months on these meds.

Side Effects: weight gain/sleepless nights/mood swings/hot flushes/hair thinning the menopause all over again sadly but stick with it.
Comments: Thankfully after 5 years still in remission and no cancer on mamo just had.  Its not nice but stick with it. Now i have ceased for a week i am getting symptons still but they lessen each day.

Side Effects: Fatigue_ body and joint aches_ mental fog_ Flu-Like Syndrome. Felt like I was being poisoned and was 50 going on 95 years of age. Cancer was easier.

Insomnia at first but that went away.  After about 2 months_ started becoming fatigued_ deep ache in left shoulder and forearm_ hands and feet have severe stiffness and joint tenderness_ weakness in arms and hands_ feels like flu without the fever/chills and nausea_ muscle tenderness as if bruised in left hand and thigh_ facial sweating (doesn't last long)_ and itching on scalp and body.
Comments: It usually takes 3-4 hours after waking_ in order to move normally and not be so fatigued. (I take meds in a.m.)  Heat packs and Aleve and/or Acetaminophen seem to help but can't take everyday.  I switched back to Tamoxifen after haven taken it for a year without any of side effects except for hot flashes and occasional insomnia.  It's only been a little over a week but I still have the side effects from Aromasin.

Side Effects: Pain in joints/headache/sore throat/sex painful/extreme confusion/
Comments: Would rather risk death then to feel like I'm dying everyday.  And the side effects don't go away in a week like promised!

Side Effects: My Side Effects have been more constant of : Headaches_ Mood Swings_ Vaginal Dryness and Bleeding. Very Bad Insomnia _ Nightly. Exercising has helped very much Walking Daily and Aerobic Exercising. At the beginning I was taking  Terrible aside Effects _ taken off and Started AROMASIN.
Comments: Anxiety _ Nervousness_ Difficulty Concentration. Moods changes for No Reason. Crying over little things_ Appetite seems to be up and down.Body Aches_ Headaches for no reason. Blurred Vision sometimes. Joint Pain.

3/11/13 -The hotflashes have improved somewhat. However_ I am sick of the constant perspiring!! My skin is messed up (was always complimented on my skin looking so young before). Aged. Am on DHEA cream for vag. dryness. Seems to help. The headaches at night are maddening. I NEED SLEEP. I was only stage one with no metastases (spelled right?)  Had total mastectomy with recon. I wonder if this is necessary. Dr. said contributing to osteopenia (precursor to osteoporis).AS OF 4/25_ onc gave permission to go off!!!  Said no proof after 5 years of hormone therapy that there is any further benefit.  Said my prognosis is 99%plus because I did the hormone therapy.  I went 7 years_ so it is pretty certain.  Onc said because I had chemo before surgery_ had total mast._ and have been clean for 7 years with the hormone therapy and because of the type of cancer it was_ my prognosis is practically 100% without further aromasin or subs.  Praise God!!  Worth asking the questions!!

Side Effects: Severe body aches and pains--hips_shoulders_ neck_ arms_ legs_ even feet. Craving for carbs_ sweets_ etc. never before experienced. Occasional periods of sweats_ insomnia_ high blood pressure. Mild depression and "grouchiness".
Comments: It is a heinous drug_ but according to my oncologist_ a life saver_ so I will continue to take it.

Side Effects: already have arthritis..now worse than ever... can't walk... one knee buckles and the other feels like a knife going through it. can't sleep ...am awaiting knee replacements..wish I had never gone on it...I should have trusted my intuition.  I had only a small breast cancer and one lymph node
Comments: doubled my arthritic pain.... hope now that I have stopped it will revert back..have to go in to teach after this spring break..am afraid I may start crying because of the pain..why did they not warn me this could be so bad.?

Side Effects: Haven't really experienced any side effects with Aromasin to date.   I had breast cancer 9 years ago and took  tamoxifen (no effects) for three years and then Femara.  Femara made me feel like I was 100 years old.  I took for two years and then quit.  I think that it was over several months that it made me feel that way.  It seemed like it was a cumulative effect over time.   So far_ tho_ so good with Aromasin.  We'll see over time

All went well for first 2 months; then side effects kicked in. Almost immediately_ had a craving for sweets; then at 2 months_ severe mood swings_ some Pain bottom of feet; At 3 months_ shoulders and neck pain_ severe insomnia; 3 months_ nausea and dizzyiness.
Comments: The most dibilitating side effects for me_ because I have to speak publicly in my work_ is the naseau (It seems to sweep over me and then passes about half an hour). I had been taking right after breakfast_ I am now going to take in afternoon. It seems nausea occurs with me about 4-5 houyrs after takining.

Side Effects: severe bone_ joint_ muscle pain_ loss of short term memory. This has disrupted my life completely_ although I keep a good attitude. I needed to see that I am not alone. I am considering going off the med to see where I am at with pain_ so I can gauge what meds I need and dont need. I want my life back !
Comments: It was prescribed to me after all other choices of aramatase inhibitors failed. It does the job_ but after having a total hysterectomy in 2010_ I wonder if I even need it_ I certainly dont need the side effects !

Side Effects: depression_ bone pain

Side effects - due to Aromasin or not?Thinning hairfacial hair ( particularly in last year)vagine dryness -almost immediatelylibido - significantly diminished - within two yearsinsomnia -  since beginingjoint pains in feet_ hips and achiness in legs - since beginninghot flashes/night sweats  - have diminshedneuropathy in fingersdistortion in one hand of fingers with large lump on thumb (just this past year)carpal tunnelBloody-awful unexplained shoulder and neck pain which extended into head and facial muscles and jaw for 6 monthsNow jsut diagnosed with  mild degenerative osteoarthritis which is causing me to walk with a caneBone scan in 20011 showed above average bone density for age.Still alive
Comments: I started tamoxifen in 2006 and was changed to Aromisin in 2008.  I am on it optionally now_ but I am truly scared to go off it as I am sure it is keeping me alive and micromestastes at bay.  Quality of life is an issue thought and right now I cannot do the things I have enjoyed all my life_ including dance.  It might not be Aromasin but certainly from reading previuos posts_ I am wondering.

Side Effects: 24/7 Headaches (enough to get an MRI which was clean)_ gained 30 pounds in 4 months_ burning in arms and legs that feels like they are on fire_ joint/muscle pain (have RA which was under control until this drug)_ extreme fatigue_ memory loss_ vaginal dryness.
Comments: Took tamoxifen for a year with a few side effects (hot flashes were the worst) but bearable.  They switched me to Aromasin in February because of being post-menopausal.  Feels like I have had one long headache ever since.  Stopped taking it 4 days ago - does anyone know how long it will take to get out of my system?  Going to ask my oncologist to put me back on tamoxifen.

Side Effects: I started on Arimidex after lumpectomy_ chemo & radiation. I didn't last long - 6 months - felt like 80 years old. My oncologist switched me to aromasin. It was tons time better! 2 years later - in last 6 months-  I have severe pains and need Tylenol or ibuprofen daily. Legs_ hips mostly. Most recently_ I can't close my right hand into a fist and middle finger is "trigger" finger. Working out at gym seems to help. Feel sluggish but my family doctor has me on phentermine (30 mg) and I take it almost daily unless I sleep in. (insomnia if you take too late in day). Tired of pain and not being able to walk fast but will tough it out if necessary!!  Question I have is does anyone ever get these little shots of pain randomly all over every once in a while?

Rapid 30lb weight gain.foot and hand aches_no energy_ carpal tunnel type pain in wrists_ sad feeling and tired.VERY stiff in joints_ especially after sitting or sleeping. Irritable!! Did I mention very dry in the Netherlands. I also took tamoxifen for >3 yrs and I prefer that drug to Aromasin. Hope it's helping but I feel lousy : (

Weight Gain_ Nausea_ bone pain_ developed protruding growths on my tendons in my hands_ foot pain_ acne_ menopausal symptoms even though I have already gone through menopause_ water retention_ craving for sweets_ a veeling of fullness or heaviness all over my body.  Only someone who has taken this drug should prescribe it!  Of couse the drs don't tell you about the side effects because they have never taken it.  My dr actually said and I quote " I can't believe you would go through Chemo and then question me about taking a little pill"  I said the reason I was questioning him was because I was scared to death and I had cancer_ all he had was a degree!  I asked him did he have cancer?  Has he gone through this?  He said no_ I said so pretty much you don't know the answer right? "  He was so pissed off at me but I don't care_ it is my body_ my breasts_ my life and I have a right to know.
Comments: I have 4 more years to go on this drug and I am afraid that it is only doing me harm vs getting rid of any cancer in my body.  The chemotherapy I did for 8 months wasn't this bad.  If I thought I could get away with not taking this drug and be "normal" again I would stop it in a heartbeat.  Just typing this is making my hands ache.  it is a horrible thing to not be able to discuss the side effects with someone who knows what they are talking about.  There are very few drs that have been through this so of course they say that there are no side effects_ they have never taken this drug.  they perhaps should listen to the people that have taken the drug but none of us have those things that they have____a degree_ all we have is cancer.

Side Effects: hands_ knees_ and feet really hurt. hot flashes_ mood swings_ fatigue.  my blood glucose levels and blood pressure have increased even though I am losing weight
Comments: I had stage 0 breast cancer/dcis.  I don't really know if it is worth all the agony.

Side Effects: Stiff joints_ extreme pain in joints and muscles.  Like giving myself the flu everyday.
Comments: I have early stage breast cancer--I resent having a blanket dose of 25mg per day prescribed when less doses are effective according to the studies I've read. 25mg is the same dose for mestaaticized BC. used to strink tumors--i don't have that!!

Side Effects: arthritis in my hips_ which was a nuisance but did not really affect my quality of life_ has been greatly exacerbated.  I cannot put on my socks or tie shoes.  Pains in hips_ knees_ shins and feet at night.  Difficulty rolling over in bed and getting out of chairs.  I also have carpal tunnel symptoms. I am having a trial period of a month off the medication.  I have been off for three weeks.  I have been going to physical therapy three times a week for the past ten weeks_ and have finally seen quite a bit of improvement the last week or two.  Also have hot flashes.
Comments: My first breast cancer (2002) had no estrogen involvement.  My second_ this past year_ had a very small amount.  I am thinking of asking the oncologist to take me off this medicine when I see her next week after my four week trial dropping the exemestane.

Side Effects: TERRIBLE JOINT AND MUSCLE PAIN 24/7 HAVE A HARD TIME STRAITENING LEGS OUT IN THE MORNING. SIT A FEW MINUTES HAVE A HARD TIME TO GET MOVING. ACNE IS REALLY BAD AND DEEP ANY ONE ELSE HAVE THIS. GENERALLY HURT ALL OVER AND VERY TIRED. CRAVE SWEETS SOMETHING AWEFUL
Very stiff joints after sitting for 10-15 min. Hands swelling.   Extreme shoulder pain. Weight gain. Hard to get out of a chair after sitting for just a few minutes.
Unbelievable joint pain!!!

Hot flashes_ joint pain - comes and goes_ numbness in arms/ hands_ loss of appetite_ weight loss_ acne. Acne started week 5. Am worried about  more possible androgenic effects like facial hair or thinning of hair on head! Not sure I'll be able to stay on this drug.

Within 2 weeks after starting this medication these symptoms set in. Numbness_ major joint pain_ all fingers/thumb triggering_ burning_ cannot make a fist in both hands_ pain in forearms and now shooting pains in hands.  Stopped medication approx. 4 weeks ago but still have these side effects. My  Doctor and also the Oncologist were pushing carpel tunnel syn surgery.  They seem to  have no knowledge of this serious side effect of the medication I was prescribed. Or had their head in the sand.
Comments: Any suggestions to reverse side effects would be greately appreciated and if anyone can give me an idea of a time frame they got back to normal after stopping this medication_I would welcome that information also.

Side Effects: Severe thumb and wrist pain. Trigger thumb.
Comments: I started taking Femara which only lasted for 3 months. I had severe side effect such as body pain_ confusion_ difficulty getting up in the morning and walking. I would hobble around the house for 2-3 hours before I could really stand up straight and walk normally. My joints hurt so bad I could not sleep at night.

Side Effects: Off and on shoulder pain_ extreme depression_ tiredness_ hot flashes_ muscle and bone pain in legs_ dizziness_ heart palpitations_ headache_ hair loss_ memory problems_ extreme sugar cravings
Comments: I started off with only hot flashes_ but now have so many side effects I'm considering going off the drug. Tried to take it every other day_ but there was no improvement. The two side effects that affect me the most are the heart palpitations and the depression. I'm also worried about bone loss due to osteoporosis and having already broken a wrist and a hip.

Side Effects: After 2 years on Tamoxifen_ switched to Arimidex.  Only lasted 3 months_ then switched to Aromasin.  Muscle and joint pain all over body_ trouble walking in the morning_ hair loss_ gained 30 lbs_ severe fatigue.  Most severe pain was tendonitis in both thumbs and both wrists which was debilitating.  Had to wear splints and was awake all night with pain.  Oncologist discounted this as a side effect of the medication so I am looking for treatment elsewhere.  Off this drug for 2 weeks_ I am already seeing significant improvement to wrists_ but not to thumbs.  I have currently been switched back to Tamoxifen.
Comments: I feel guilty for not completing the three years on this drug.  I can accept the full body pain which at times can be depressing.  I can also accept and endure the other side effects_ but the wrist and thumb pain...feeling as if all of my tendons are moving and popping_ and almost fainting from the pain each time I take a shower...l could not endure that.  I am hoping that this damage is not permanent!

Side Effects: Must decide if the side effects are interupting the quality of your life.  Muscle stiffness and joint pain limit my activities.  Doctors don't always tell you side effects you might experience.  Report every physical and emotional change to your physician.

Because Arimidex caused so many side effects (I posted several times on the Arimidex page)_ my doctor suggested trying Aromasin. After taking just one pill_ I had painful_ sudden reflux causing painful_ long-lasting burning in my esophagus.
Comments: Arimidex had also caused many digestive problems_ but not the terrible burning. The original side effects from Arimidex were nearly gone when I started Aromasin_ but it made the digestion problems start all over again: reflux_ burning_ bloating_ gas all the time_ smelly stools_ and loose stools. With this much discomfort and interference with my daily activities_ I stopped at one pill and will wait till symptoms improve and try again. If this does not work_ I am stopping altogether. My surgeon is wonderful and agreed with me that existing in misery in order to take a pill that may (or may not) help with a recurrence of cancer isn't much of a life. I'd rather be functional and enjoy life to the fullest than be miserable for five years taking a medicine that my body is clearly rejecting! It concerns me that this type of medicine may have long lasting effects on our bodies. Reading the posts for Arimidex and Femara nearly bring tears to my eyes -- we are not making this up_ yet it seems that we have to defend ourselves if we have a doctor who refuses to acknowledge with compassion what we are going through. That's why I quit two oncologists and have a new_ very understanding and empathetic doctor. What I want as a patient is to be heard.

Side Effects: Took Tamoxifen for two years-switched to Aromasin third year at doc's suggestion.  Less dangerours side effects.  Bones good. Horrible hot flushes and lack of sleep becasuse of. Vaginal area dried up. Gained 30 pounds immediately and have less energy (lack of sleep-exercising less?)Memory loss-have a horible time remebering names of even people I know well sometimes.
Comments: Went off for over two months and slept better and had almost normal skin in vaginal area.  Checked in with oncologist who suggested that as my hot flushes were not a great deal less than before_ I might consider going back on as we don't really know if I would recurr or not without it.  Cost has gone up dramatically_ but husband does not want to take a chance of recurrance.  Memory loss is my greatest concern_ other wise can deal with the rest. (KY gel)

Side Effects: Insomnia_ rolling hot flashes_ severe joint pain_ bone pain_ muscle pain_ nausea & vomiting_ 30 pound weight gain in the first 6 months_ fatigue_ and some hair thinning.
Comments: The pain is worse in my feet and hands_ sometimes debilitating. I have had to go on several "medication vacations" of 2-3 weeks duration every so many months -- with my Oncologist's knowledge - in order to agree to stay on the Aromasin for 5 years. HATEFUL drug

Side Effects: Intense pain on my shoulders and the outside of my arms.  I could feel the pain even when my arms and shoulder were still.  I cried out in pain.  I did not take pain medication because of a long drive to work.  I stopped taking it for a month earlier this year to see if it was causing the pain.  I think I need to stop it for a longer period since the shoulder/arm/elbow pain has increased significantly over the past year.  A shoulder specialist told me it was a pinched nerve; my family doctor said it was osteoarthritis (funny how it started in both shoulders and arms at the same time_ isn't it); my original oncologist didn't think aromasin was the problem.  However_ my keen intuition says it is and the shoulder pain comments I've read from others taking aromasin_ tells me it is.  I'll speak with my new oncologist after the holidays.

I was on femara prior to aromasin.  The pain was awful. I ached in my knees so bad I couldn't walk at times_ feet hurt when I first stand up. Week hand muscles_ hair is not growing back like it should. Night sweats_ache like I have the flu most days. Memory is better than it was on Chemo but not back to normal. Dr. switched me to Aromasin and the pain is less. It is bearable but I still have all the same symptons.  5 years of this makes me wonder - there must be a better way.
muscle pain_ extreme increase in blood sugar and blood pressure that came under control once stopped medicine.
hands hurt and could not make a fist_ found doing simple chores was a chore could not sleep because pain was so great
Comments: it may have helped me with the breast cancer but the side affects are terrible

Side Effects: Severe joint pain in fingers_knees and hips
Comments: Better then Arimidex but switching to tamoxifen

Side Effects: I have not taken this drug. I chose to have a total vaginal hysterectomy with removal of my ovaries.
Comments: There are 3 places that estrogen comes from. Ovaries_ Adrenal Glands and Fat Cells. I have removed my ovaries and I eat very well and exercise. I would rather live a quality life than one filled with pain. I'm mentally stable and love life. I've read so many cases of women who are taking these estrogen blockers and still have a recurrance. I took femara and by the 4th day I couldn't straighten out my left middle finger_ had back pain and headaches. It's a choice you have to make. I wish everyone the best and remember one thing. You're in charge of your own life. There are success stories of people who contine to keep  cancer at bay by the way they choose to live. Exercise and diet go hand in hand_ one without the other will not work. I went straight into menopause after surgery but I'm  taking suppliments that are estrogen free to handle the hot flashes. If you need any positive reinforcement please email me. I'll be happy to help. I'm not a doctor_ just a woman who has had breast cancer and chooses quality of life.

Side Effects: I have had NO side effects with this medicine and would highly recommend it to anyone who has been on Femara with bad side effects.
Comments: Although I haven't been on this medicine for a long time_ I know that I would have already experienced the side effects by now.  I was on Femara (which to say the least_ was a total nightmare)for about 2 months but the side effects were well on their way within a few doses.  Aromasin is a godsend!

Side Effects: I am experiencing hot flashes; severe joint pain with extreme stiffness after sitting for more than 20 minutes; carb cravings; worsening of carpal tunnel symptoms; numbness in fingers; imsomnia; uncontrolled emotional swings (unexpected crying); difficulty to concentrate (could be residual chemo brain); pronounced fatigue due to greater joint pain experienced.
Comments: I would like to switch to an alternative aromatase inhibitor but I'm afraid they all have negative side effects.  I will try to eliminate or at least cut down on animal proteins and instead attempt to get more protein from grains_ fruits and veggies.

Side Effects: Started Aromasin two weeks ago after 7 months on Femara. Switched due to side effects_ which have been worse on aromasin. I have severe fatigue. It's like going through chemo again. Joint pain_ bone pain_ headaches_ hot flashes_ having trouble sleeping. Heaviness in chest for last two days_ like I had after each Herceptin treatment. I see my oncologist next week. I'm almost to the point of going off these meds and taking my chances. Quality of life is so important to me. If I have 5 or 10 years before the cancer returns_ I'd rather live it without these symtoms!!!

joint pain and stiffness_ extreme anxiety_ hyped up_ sleep disturbance_ memory loss_ hot flashes - but the worst was that I had frequent heart palpitations and several episodes of cardiac arrythmia which has stopped now that I am off the drug.
Comments: I think the extreme depletion of estrogen caused by this drug was more than my body could handle.  I know the studies are positive in terms of it being effective in preventing a recurrence for stage 1 breast cancer_ but I did not want to sacrifice my heart in the process!

Side Effects: initially arm and wrist pain culminating in severe pain of the wrists mri scan confirms ulnar synovitis
Comments: Why does this occur? What is the treatment? Do the symptoms lessen after one stops taking the drug(two years ago in my case)I am seeing a rheumatologist and taking hydroxychloroquin with little effect

Side Effects: right arm hurts between shoulder and elbow_ had issue with left ankle hurting like it was broken.  left leg hurts early in the morning_ must use heating pad to sleep.  But still better than Femara.
Comments: Aromasin is the best one for me so far.  Femara is awful Arimidex caused mood changes and joint pain.  It seems that they could come up with something better.  Has anyone had ankle issues?

Side Effects: Terrible joint and muscle pain.  No energy whatsoever.
Comments: Started off on Tamoxifen and my consultant changed that after two years to Arimidex but with the joint pain was changed to Aromasin.  Unfortunately I am still in severe pain - paracetamol etc do not help and strong painkillers upset my stomach.  Feel like stopping Aromasin altogether but scared of the bc recurring.

Reason: Femara did not work for me
Side Effects: knee and joint pain.
joint pains_carpal tunnel_hot flashes_ facial sweating-not associated with the hot flashes_ trigger finger and foot pain.
fatigue_ important joint and bone pain_ dryness_ loss of sexual life
have been on Aromasin almost 1 yr..have just now noticed ankle and wrist pain _particularly in the am. Awaken during the nite with numbness in both arms
Comments: Have been on Tamoxifen 5 mo.Arimidex 1 yr Like Aromasin much better than previous meds

Side Effects: had serious carb cravings gained 20#s in the 1st 2 months; depression; headaches 24/7; felt stiff-with difficulty getting from sitting to standing-had difficulty walking; felt out of breath; fatigue; legs hurt; stomach/intestinal issues; insomnia
Comments: I was diagnosed in Oct 01 with infiltrating lobular carcinoma_ had a tumor greater than 10cm_ no nodes were involved.  did 3 months chemotherapy_ & 5yrs of Tamoxifen._it was tolerable.  My oncologist put me on Femara_ took it 2 months_ had about 25 side effects...I told my Dr. I cannot take this any more_ get me off of this.  So was put me on Arimidex_ tried it for 2 months - found it to be equally untollerable_ many side effects_ felt like I had chemo brain much worse than when I was on chemo_ to the point of not being sure I could find my way home on several days...told my doctor that it was not worth it_ who cares if it might prolong life if you are unable to function_ told them I was going to end up on Soc Sec disability for mental impairment if I stayed on it_ it scared me to be on it.  So then they put me on Aromasin...after 2 months started getting headaches_ felt ill (flu-like + more) all the time_ was exhausted all the time - insomnia for 3-4 nights_ then would "colap

Side Effects: severe wrist pain_ frozen thumb_ couldn't bend at all without bad pain. Tired_no energy and slight depression
Comments: Was treated for breast cancer in 2000 followed by chemo radiation and then tamoxafin.Started aromasin 1 1/2 years ago.Quit last september and feel awesome!!! Slight pain in wrist_ everything else is gone. My quality of life is more important. Good luck to you all

Side Effects: Total loss of libido. Bone pain. I did not have a recurrence of breast cancer while taking this drug_ but I have no way of knowing whether or not it protected me.

Took Tamoxifen for 2 yrs with side effects that included extreme hot flushes_ nausea (like morning sickness)_ horrible insomnia & headaches.  Switched to Aromasin for next 2 yrs and it was tolerable for the first 6 months with same side effects as Tamoxifen.  Then the bone & joint pain in the outer extremities started. Couldn't get out of a bed or a seated position or do stairs without feeling like a cripple.  Mornings were worse & I too had the 'claw' effect with terrible weakness in my hands. Ankles felt fragile_ as though the bones would break with the slightest pressure.  Once healthy libido disappeared_ urogenital system dried up & cholesterol levels tripled_ although no change in exercise & diet. Doctor switched me to Femara 2 months ago.  After the 1st week_ I actually slept for two whole nights & felt awesome! Then the side effects of the Femara kicked in & it's starting to feel the same as with the Aromasin.
Comments: I'm so thankful to have found this website! Over the last few years_ I've so often thought that I was the only one experiencing these awful side effects. Until diagnosis_ I was very fit & worked out 5x/week - weights and cardio. I continued to work & work-out even through chemo cycles. Now I feel like a 90 yr old asexual being. Chemo-induced menopause presented its own challenges but these Aromatase-Inhibitor side effects continue to affect the quality of my life.  Doctors are quick to offer Rx for side effects but each Rx has its own risks & side effects. It's a domino effect & I just want to feel 'normal' again & get on with my life.  It would be so different if we were dealing with a broken arm.  An X-ray would show the break_ time would heal the fracture & then it would be nothing but a memory.  Nobody knows if these AI drugs even work on something we don't even know is or isn't there.  Quality vs Quantity of life should be addressed by somebody!

Side Effects: Bad pain in joints_wrist and thumb the worst.Insommnia_I was treated by both by the GP Nothing worked.It's getting worse as the days go by.Have been taking for  months after Femera which was just as bad
Comments: I have stopped taking for 3 weeks now_I can bend my thumb_and pain isn't as severe.Lost 12 pounds too_ which was a bonus!Still have insomnia_and I'm going to try to see my Gp for that today.Took today off work.

Side Effects: joint pain.trigger thumb.carpo tunnel_insommnia_pain in feet.
Comments: I want to go off_I hate taking it and would like to know if it will go away

Reason: post op treatment of breast cancer
Side Effects: joint pain--especially in fingers and feet.  Greatly increased appetite and carb cravings--weight gain
Comments: Difficult to rate this medicine until I know the benefit outweighs the side effects.

Side Effects: Horrible insomnia_ brain fog_ depression_ food cravings/weight gain.  Like worse case of PMS ever and getting worse each month. Lost 70 pounds after diagnosis & kept off till started Aromasin.  Put 40 back on in about 3 months. Just couldn't make my brain care or tell me to stop craving carbs.
Comments: I was estrogen+ and HER2+. Had mastectomy/chemo/radiation and over 2 years on Tamoxifen. Did great. Switched to Aromasin and immediately things started going wrong.  After one year_ I have refused to take.  Even people at work commented how much better I seemed to be after I stopped taking for two weeks. Began sleeping the whole night w/in two days of stopping.  Have lost 4 lbs. My brain works! Oncologist REALLY wants me to be on adjuvant therapy for another 2 years or so. Will start Arimidex next week. Trying to be positive.

Side Effects: Stiffness in hands_ feet_ knees and neck. Fuzzy head_ memory loss.  Feel "old". Achy when I get up from sitting. Bone density is declining per scans to opteopenia. Same side effects but worse w/Arimidex.
Comments: I took tamoxifen 1st year_ Arimidix my second year_Aromasin my 3rd yr(now) and thinking of asking my doctor to switch to Femara or back to tamoxifen for the last 2 years.

Side Effects: Severe joint pain_ carpal tunnel syndrome in left arm_ painful feet_ weight gain_ digestive problems_ especially constipation.
Comments: My doctor put me on Aromasin after I had complained about the unbearable side effects I was experiencing with Arimidex.  However_ after a couple of months of the new drug I felt even worse than I had felt when taking Arimidex.  I ache all over all day and night and can no longer exercise or carry things. It is now 18 months since I first started taking exemestane medicine_  and I have decided to give it up for a month before I next see my cancer specialist.  He had mentioned to me about five months ago that_ since I was one of those patients who had experienced extreme side effects_ perhaps I could benefit by switching to Tamoxifen.  I must say I'm not keen.  I have discussed the question with my family doctor and pyschotherapist_ and both agree that_ in the end_ only I take the decision to stop. So that's what I am going to do.

Side Effects: After three weeks of taking this drug my doctor switch me to arimidex (not much better) due to joint pain_ headaches_ nausea and vomiting.
Trigger thumb and wrist pain.
Comments: I started taking Aromasin as an alternative to Arimidex_ which had given me severe joint pains and general discomfort.  Apart from developing trigger thumb and wrist pain - since dealt with by my rheumatologist - I have been feeling much better on Aromasin and no longer have painful feet and joints.  A great improvement.

Side Effects: Depression_ anxiety_ frequent hot flashes.
Comments: I had no side effects from the previous drug I was on_ which was Femara.  As soon as I started taking Aromasin I felt a deep depression overcome me_ as well as considerable anxiety.  I don't know yet if the drug is helping slow down my cancer.  I've been on it for a little over 2 months.

Side Effects: pain in hands_ pinky and ring finger on both hands stiff_ severe wrist pain_ pain in feet in morning_ sweats_ tingling sensation before a sweat_ fatigue_ pain in toes_ nighttime pain in legs Especially calves_ extreme insomnia_ problems with short term memory
Comments: DO THESE SIDE EFFECTS LAST AFTER TREATMENT WITH THIS DRUG has ended?

Side Effects: a great deal of joint pain

Foot and leg achiness_ short term memory problems.  Feel very old some days but that has not deterred me from going to the gym four times per week.  I am in better shape today than before my BRCA. I take Tylenol or ibuprofen for the pain.
Comments: As my oncologist said_ it is only pain.  There are no real side effects due to the leg and foot pain.  I am Factor V positive and cannot take tamoxifin.  I trust my oncologist as he is one of the pioneers in discovering and treating hormone receptive BRCA.  Thanks to my doc at the U of Michigan_ I have an excellent prognosis_ and that is really what it is all about. No pain_ no gain!

Side Effects: Tired_ short-term memory loss_ travelling pain throughout body_ frozen thumb_ stiff fingers.
Comments: On tamoxifen 1 1/2 years and aromasin about 2 years.  Doctor switched me to aromasin due to estrogen driven tumor. Increased to 600-800 IU of Vitamin D. This eliminated the travelling pain. Frozen thumb is pretty much back to normal. INCREASED VITAMIN D REALLY HELPED THE PAIN! Eliminated carbonated drinks containing phosphoric acid.

Side Effects: pain in hands/fingers locking_ shoulder pain_ very tired
Comments: was on three months_ lots of joint pain_ was on Fosamax at same time which has same side effects_ went off both_ felt better_ went back on Aromasin_ hands stiff and painful again

Side Effects: pain in hands/fingers locking_ shoulder pain_ very tired
Comments: was on three months_ lots of joint pain_ was on Fosamax at same time which has same side effects_ went off both_ felt better_ went back on Aromasin_ joints stiff and painful again

Side Effects: Switched from tamoxifen after significant weight gain - to Arimidex. Experienced severe joint pain. Switched by oncologist to Aromasin. Experienced trigger finger in both thumbs_ frozen thumb_ can't walk on my feet in the morning. Accupuncture helped the fozen thumb (avoided recommended surgery)and is somewhat helping the feet. Age 66 but feel as if I'VE AGED 20 YEARS.
Comments: This Rx may be a life saver_ but as an estrogen blocker_ I am philosophically against it_ because I think a woman needs her estrogen every day. Given the side effects of all 3 drugs I've taken I would like to stop all Rx. Trying not to be stupid though.

Side Effects: joint pain in thumb_ return of plantar fascitis_ reduced hot flashes from tamoxifen_ memory fuzzy_ ? skin rashes?_ shortness of breath_ but it's hard to pinpoint aromasin as THE cause.
Comments: skin rash appered shortly after started taking it_ thought it was something else_ but have no other explanation for rash_ which is spreading.  ditto for thumb pain- in joint/tendon.  otherwise_ it seems easeir than the tamoxifen.

Side Effects: lethargic_ feeling of fullness_ short term memory loss
Comments: it is difficult to know effectiveness since only taking it for a short period & also may have interaction with other medications that I am taking.
